threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

attributes.magic: ELF 32-bit LSB executable, Synopsys ARCompact ARC700 cores, version 1 (SYSV), statically linked, stripped

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis: This RISC-V binary is an IoT botnet agent, likely a variant of the Mirai or Gafgyt families. It contains hardcoded SSDP discovery strings (M-SEARCH) used for network scanning or UPnP-based reflection attacks. The sample includes a spoofed Windows Chrome User-Agent string to mask its outbound traffic and performs system reconnaissance by querying /proc/cpuinfo and /proc/stat. The presence of complex jump-based control flow and architecture-specific obfuscated string templates is consistent with malicious botnet persistence and propagation behavior.
